newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey says French interest in Turkmen gas line.
newsitem.headline: Turkey says French interest in Turkmen gas line.

text.p: Turkish Energy Minister Recai Kutan said on Tuesday that French companies had expressed interest in building a gas pipeline from Turkmenistan to Europe via Iran and Turkey.
"We will sign an agreement with Turkmenistan next week for the Turkmen gas to reach Europe through a pipeline," he told reporters.
"Turkmenistan has a potential to sell up to 30 billion cubic metres of gas annually and it plans to sell it to Europe through a pipeline," he said.
"There are many foreign firms interested in the deal, especially French firms," he said, but declined to name any company.

Kutan returned from an official trip to Turkmenistan last week after sealing a deal for Turkey to get an initial three billion cubic metres of gas a year from 1998. He said he would return to Asgabadat next week with President Suleyman Demirel to attend a regional meeting of Islamic countries.
He said Turkmen gas would reach Turkey through an existing pipeline from Turkmenistan to Iran's Tabriz and another pipeline to be built from Tabriz to Ankara.
The line to Europe will link Turkey to Bulgaria and Austria, according to the original proposal made several years ago.
